In the wake of the Buffalo, Uvalde, and Highland Park mass shootings, and as gun violence continues to tear our communities apart, Congress finally passed the Bipartisan Safer Communities Act , legislation to enhance background checks, help keep guns away from domestic abusers, and invest in mental health and support after traumatic events. But there is still an urgent need for comprehensive legislation that builds on the package we passed.

Yesterday, I introduced the Prairie Band Potawatomi Nation Shab-eh-nay Band Reservation Settlement Act. This bill will enable the Nation to reclaim a portion of land stolen nearly two centuries ago, and to be rightfully compensated. It's an important first step toward justice.
